snippet: Those who have lost jobs to foreigners on temporary visas, in particular, have begun to speak out despite their severance agreements with companies.
abstract: Increasing number of laid-off American workers who have signed non-disparagement agreements are nonetheless speaking out against former employees who outsourced their jobs to foreign workers on temporary visas; Democratic and Republican lawmakers have questioned such severance agreements, and some have put forth changes to visa laws that include measures allowing former employees to contest their layoffs.
lead_paragraph: Those who have lost jobs to foreigners on temporary visas, in particular, have begun to speak out despite their severance agreements with companies.

headline.main: Laid-Off Americans, Required to Zip Lips on Way Out, Grow Bolder
headline.print_headline: Laid-Off Americans, Required to Zip Lips on Way Out, Are Growing Bolder
